markdownRemark.html:
Message from our

Founder


Hi everyone!

I wanted to introduce myself as well as give a little background story as to how Pre-Law Shadowers was created back in March 2021. My name is Ayisha Jilani and I am a student at the University of Toronto currently majoring in Political Science and Public Law. I am an aspiring future lawyer and have always known I wanted to pursue a career in the legal field for as long as I can remember.

During the pandemic, I found it incredibly difficult to find opportunities that helped me gain exposure to the legal profession and was seriously doubting what I wanted to do after my undergrad. One night, I was talking to a friend about how I wish there was a platform for students like myself to network with legal professionals, a way for us to shadow with lawyers, for example, and find out more about what a day in their career looks like.

Suddenly it hit me, there was clearly an opening for an organization of this kind and I knew I was not the only one struggling to find something like this. With the help of support and encouragement from friends and family, I stepped out of my comfort zone and took a leap of faith. That is how Pre-Law Shadowers came to be!

I remember worrying about how this would all work out and whether people would be interested or not. Months later, I can confidently say that Pre-Law Shadowers has exceeded my expectations and rapidly grown to where it is today. We have also hired an amazing team of dedicated individuals, who I am very proud to be working with.

I hope you become a part of the Pre-Law Shadowers community, and that we can help you with your future academic journey.

Sincerely,

Ayisha Jilani
